text: Geoffrey Boycott has scored 23 centuries in Test cricket and One Day Internationals. Geoffrey Boycott is a former English cricketer. A right-handed batsman, he played for England between 1964 and 1982, including captaining them for 4 Tests and 2 ODIs between 1977 and 1978, and made 23 centuries in international cricket, 22 in Tests and 1 in One Day Internationals. he sits joint fifty-sixth in the list of century-makers in international cricket. Boycott made his Test debut against Australia at Trent Bridge, Nottingham on 4 June 1964. He scored his first Test century, also against Australia, in the final match of the same series at The Oval, London on 13 August 1964, scoring 113. He scored his final Test century against India at the Feroz Shah Kotla, Delhi on 23 December 1981, scoring 105. His final Test match was the following game of the same series at Eden Gardens, Calcutta (now Kolkata) on 1 January 1982, having played 108 matches, and also held the record for the most runs in Test cricket at the time, with 8,114 runs. His highest score in Tests is 246 not out, scored against India at Headingley, Leeds on 8 June 1967. Boycott made his One Day International (ODI) debut against Australia in the inaugural One Day International at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne on 5 January 1971 and played his final ODI against India at the Gandhi Stadium, Jalandhar on 20 December 1981, having played 36 matches. His only century in the format came against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney on 11 December 1979. == Key == {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" style="width:75px" | Symbol !
